titleStmt.title: King of kings, or, The soveraignty of Salus Populi, over all kings, princes, and powers whatsoever likewise, divers clear, solid and sober arguments and reasons against the claims of Charls Stuart, or any of that race to the government of England, &c. : proving also that its treason in him, so in his siders with , and seconders, to attempt it under what specious pretences soever : lastly, making it good against all opposers, that his Highness the Lord Protector, hath a true and undeniable right to the government of England / written on purpose to satisfie the judgements and consciences of all sorts, whether religious or royalist or any other adversary whatsoever, about the great and weighty questions of this time, viz. who it is that hath right to the government, &c., and thereby to check all trecherous pretences and proceedings about the same, that so our country may be kept in peace and quiet : besides divers other useful passages to affect the reader.
titleStmt.author: S. H.

titleStmt.title: King of kings, or, The soveraignty of Salus Populi, over all kings, princes, and powers whatsoever likewise, divers clear, solid and sober arguments and reasons against the claims of Charls Stuart, or any of that race to the government of England, &c. : proving also that its treason in him, so in his siders with , and seconders, to attempt it under what specious pretences soever : lastly, making it good against all opposers, that his Highness the Lord Protector, hath a true and undeniable right to the government of England / written on purpose to satisfie the judgements and consciences of all sorts, whether religious or royalist or any other adversary whatsoever, about the great and weighty questions of this time, viz. who it is that hath right to the government, &c., and thereby to check all trecherous pretences and proceedings about the same, that so our country may be kept in peace and quiet : besides divers other useful passages to affect the reader.
titleStmt.author: S. H.
Hunton, Samuel.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the author and sold by Ralph Hartford ...,

notesStmt.note: Sometimes attributed to Samuel Hunton. Cf. BM, which enters editions under both H., S., and Hunton, Samuel.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
